column2: CALIFORNIA DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You may legally block an intersection:
column4: During rush hour traffic.
column6: When you entered the intersection on the green light.
column8: Under no circumstances.

column2: 2. If it starts to rain on a hot day, the road is most slippery:
column4: for the first few minutes.
column6: after it has stopped raining.
column8: after it has been raining for a few hours.

column2: 3. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Drinking coffee.

column2: 4. You are entering a roundabout with multiple lanes, and you need to turn left at the intersection. You must:
column4: choose either lane, and exit in the lane you entered.
column6: choose the left-hand lane and exit.
column8: choose the right-hand lane and exit in the left-hand lane.

column2: 5. Bicyclists:
column4: have the same rights and responsibilities as motorized vehicles.
column6: are entitled to share the road with motor vehicles.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 6. It is illegal to park your vehicle:
column4: in a bicycle lane.
column6: within three feet of a private driveway.
column8: in an unmarked crosswalk.

column2: 7. You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Give the right-of-way to:
column4: pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a “walk” signal.
column6: oncoming vehicles also turning left.
column8: all approaching vehicles.

column2: 8. Which of these is a safe driving practice?
column4: Checking your rearview mirrors frequently.
column6: Using the high-beam lights in the fog.
column8: Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.

column2: 9. To avoid tailgating, drivers should:
column4: look into their rear view mirror.
column6: use the “three-second rule”.
column8: leave at least 25 feet between their vehicle and the vehicle ahead.

column2: 10. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 11. Which of these statements is true about drinking alcohol and driving?
column4: If you can walk a straight line after drinking, it is safe to drive.
column6: Alcohol affects judgement, which is needed for safe driving.
column8: If you are under the legal blood alcohol concentration limit, your driving isn’t impaired.

column2: 12. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop.
column6: signal other vehicles to stop.
column8: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 13. You may drive in a bike lane:
column4: if you drive slower than 15 MPH.
column6: no more than 200 feet before making a right turn.
column8: whenever bicyclists are not present.

column2: 14. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

column2: 15. California's "Basic Speed Law" says:
column4: You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.
column6: The maximum speed limit in California is 70 MPH on certain freeways.
column8: You should never drive faster than posted speed limits.

column2: 16. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.

column2: 17. If the driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk, you should:
column4: change lanes, scan the road ahead, and pass the stopped vehicles.
column6: stop, then proceed when all pedestrians have crossed.
column8: cautiously pass the vehicle at 10 MPH or less.

column2: 18. What is the speed limit for a blind intersection?
column4: 35 MPH
column6: 15 MPH
column8: 25 MPH

column2: 19. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: warn drivers.
column6: guide drivers.
column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 20. The picture shows:
column4: a speeding fines doubled sign.
column6: a railroad advance warning sign.
column8: a reversible road sign.

column2: 21. A safety zone is a specially marked area for passengers to get on or off buses or trolleys. You may not drive through a safety zone:
column4: at any time for any reason.
column6: only when a bus or trolley is present.
column8: only when a bus or trolley is unloading passengers.

column2: 22. Two vehicles are approaching an uncontrolled “T” intersection. One vehicle is on the through road and the other is on the road that ends. Who has the right-of-way at the intersection?
column4: The vehicle on the right.
column6: The vehicle that arrives first.
column8: The vehicle on the through road.

column2: 23. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column6: you can reduce fuel consumption.
column8: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 24. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: right turns are not allowed.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 25. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column8: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.

column2: 26. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in residential areas is:
column4: 15 MPH
column6: 25 MPH
column8: 20 MPH

column2: 27. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column4: Diamond
column6: Arrows
column8: Edge line

column2: 28. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 29. Never park your vehicle within __ feet of a fire station driveway.
30. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 31. You are driving on a five-lane freeway in the lane closest to the center divider. To exit the freeway on the right you should:
column4: change lanes one at a time until you are in the proper lane.
column6: slow before beginning each lane change.
column8: carefully cross all the lanes at one time.

column2: 32. Which of these statements is true about large trucks:
column4: they all have air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.
column6: they are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
column8: they take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.

column2: 33. You must notify law enforcement and file a Report Traffic Accident Occurring in California (SR 1) with DMV when:
column4: you have a collision and there is an injury or death.
column6: you intend to file a certificate of non-operation for your vehicle.
column8: your vehicle is towed for parking illegally.

column2: 34. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: turn off your engine.

column2: 35. Which of these statements is true about child passengers:
column4: Children 1 or older and over 20 pounds should ride in the front seat.
column6: The front seat is generally the safest place in the vehicle for children six years of age and older.
column8: Children under age one should not ride in the front seat in airbag-equipped vehicles.

column2: 36. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: blue; white
column6: green; white
column8: white; black
